bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, December 24, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison informs Hench that the Washington and Jefferson publication - part of the practical joke played on Hench - need not be recalled. The only copy was sent to Hench.

div1.head: Telegram from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, December 24, 1940
div1.opener:
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
WESTERN
UNION
1201
R. B. WHITE
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
SYMBOLS
DL-Day Letter
NT-Overnight Telegram
LC-Deferred Cable
NLT-Cable Night Letter
Ship Radiogram
_________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MAJ537 54 DL WASHINGTON PENN 24 727P
1940 DEC 24 PM 7 30
DR PHILLIP S HENCH= SECOND ST
div1.p:
=THANKS FOR YOUR WIRE WHICH WILL BE FRAMED. WILL NOW
ADVISE THAT THIS WAS A SPECIAL EDITION OF ONE COPY DEVISED
AND PRINTED BY MCCLAIN AS A HENCH JOKE ON HENCH. OTHER
AND CORRECT COPIES WILL FOLLOW APOLOGIES AND MERRY
CHRISTMAS FROM MCCLAIN AND NEVA PERPETRATORS AND FROM
HARRIETT THE COUNTY JUDGES AND MYSELF=
div1.closer: :HUTCH. THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
